definitions.body: :Ju Jdg 6:37 night-mist, dew (NH [[טַל]] dew; Aram. t.alo0, [[טַלָּא]] dew; Ar. t.al=un light rain, dew; Eth. t’al: dew)—´[[ט]] abs. 1Sa 1:21 + 12 t.; [[טָָל]] Ju Jdg 6:13 + 9 t.; cstr. [[טַל]] Ge 27:28 + 4 t.; sf. [[טַלֶָּךָ]] Is 26:19, [[טַלָּם]] Zec 8:12; —night-mist, taking place of our dew (v. Che Is 18:4 & Ps 110:3; Lane:1862, Neil: Pal. Explored 129); as coming from the sky and bringing fertility, [[טַל הַשָּׁמַיִם]] Ge 27:28 (God gives it, [[נתן]]), & v:Ge 27:39 (+ [[מֵעָָל]]), cf. De 33:28 (heavens distil it, [[ערף]]), Hag 1:10, Zec 8:12 (heavens give it, [[נתן]]); in De 33:13 rd. perh. [[מֵעָָל]] for [[מִטַּל]] (v. ‖ Ge 49:25 and Di); clouds distil it ([[רעף]]) Pr 3:20; sq. [[עַל]], it descends ([[ירד]]) upon the camp Nu 11:9 (JE); it is upon the ground Ju Jdg 6:39, Jdg 6:40, cf. 2Sa 1:21 (+ [[מָטָר]]); upon the fleece Ju Jdg 6:37; is wrung out ([[מוץ]]) of the fleece v:Jdg 6:38; remains through the night ([[לון]]) Job 29:19, cf. ´[[שִׁכְבַת הַטּ]] the lying of dew = the dew lying Ex 16:13, Ex 16:14 (P; it goes up ([[עלה]]) in morning); it is in drops [[מִי הוֹלִיד אֶגְלֵי טָָל]] Job 38:28; covers the head of one out at night Ct So 5:2; it comes ([[היה]]) by word of prophet 1Ki 17:1 (+ [[מָטָר]]); sim. of stealthy approach [[כַּאֲשֶׁר יִפּׂל הַטַּל עַל־הָאֲדָמָה]] 2Sa 17:12; sim. denoting welcome and gentle refreshment, of speech, which distils ([[נזל]]) like it De 32:2 (poem; ‖[[שְׂעִירִים]], [[רְבִיבִים]]); of fraternal unity [[כְּטַל חֶרְמוֹן]] Ps 133:3 ([[ירד על]]); of king's favour Pr 19:12 ([[על]]); of ´[[י]]'s kindness Ho 14:6; [[כְּעָב טַל]] Is 18:4 like a mist-cloud, of ´[[י]]'s quiet watching; of Jacob's influence among nations Mic 5:6 (´[[מֵאֵת י]] ´[[ט]]; ‖[[רְבִיבִים]]); [[טַל אוֹרׂת טַלֶָּךָ]] Is 26:19 a dew of light is thy dew (v. I. [[אוֹרָה]], p. 21:b supr. and Baud: Stud. Sem. Rel. ii. 264 f.); as transitory, [[כַּטַּל מַשְׁכִּים הׂלֵךְ]] Ho 6:4 like the dew early departing, so Ho 13:3 (both ‖[[עַנַן־בּׂקֶר]]); fig. of young warriors of king established by ´[[י]], with flashing weapons, like dewdrops [[טַל יַלְדֻתֶָךָ]] Ps 110:3.
